intro: Baeckea leptocaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in heathlands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Baeckea leptocaulis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
